poem:
### One Big Beautiful Bill

In gilded halls,  
a scribe's hand moves—  
ink on the ledger,  
wealth's silent hymn.  
Brass scales tip,  
gold drips like honey  
onto white collars.  
Below, the shadow  
of promises breaks,  
thin as a whisper  
in the cold rustle  
of forgotten coats.
